sub_title: Master Geomatics with mention in Use Land Planning / Data Analyst / Disaster Risk Management / Geographic Information Systems - Systems Engineering
summary:
I recently, together with my husband and two sons, moved from Ecuador to The Netherlands. I am therefore looking for a job that fits with my experiences, and education and is a new start in this great Adventure of moving to a new country.

I have my master’s degree in Geomatical Information Systems (GIS) and have over 10 years of experience in the area of natural risk management and data analysis. 

In my previous positions, I managed statistics, historical data, and comparatives, and managed multidisciplinary teams. 

I am self-confident, caring, open-minded, enthusiastic, and proactive. I find myself a great communicator and motivator, both independently as well as in a team setting.

location.short: Alphen aan den Rijn, South Holland
location.default: Alphen aan den Rijn, South Holland, Netherlands

education.degree_name: Mágister en Geomática con Mención en Ordenamiento Territorial
education.field_of_study: Sistemas de Información geográfica - Ordenamiento Territorial

organizations.name: CECAPAUSTRO
organizations.position: Tutora en temas de Gestión de Riesgos y Administración de Desastres

profile_positions.description:
Working in Biodiversity and Society department,  with relevant projects about biodiversity and sustainability reporting.
Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive, adopting European sustainability reporting standards (ESRS). 
Manage geo-information, statistics and data analysis, QGis, ArcGis and implementation database PostGis. 
Creating study cases and building a framework and methodology for reporting on sustainability issues.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer GIS / Data Science

profile_positions.description:
Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze and interpret information and draw out key messages.
Relevant Skills and professional experience in program, analysis, and reporting in risk management work, including data processing, analysis, and report writing
Strong oral and written communication skills, ability to articulate insights to internal and external stakeholders
Experience and ability to perform in a multicultural and multi-disciplinary context
Strong knowledge of preparing and presenting statistics of critical analysis in Technical reports, Committees, or forums, including transparency, integrity, control, veracity, and quality of the information Highly accomplished skills in Geomatics, geographic information systems, and data analysis for making decisions.
Assess, support, and coordinate with authorities and stakeholders about disaster risk management, climate change, humanitarian assistance, and resilience.
Provide capacity-building support related to digital assessments.
Provide technical support to the development of and review of the training materials for the Academy;
Facilitate and co-deliver the Infrastructure Academy training modules.
Facilitate the engagement of the online community on Microsoft Teams around infrastructure in crisis settings;
Take part in inter-agency assessment working groups during emergency response.
Generate data visualization products, including dashboards, infographics, and maps, especially using Microsoft Power BI.
Perform GIS/satellite imagery analysis using ArcMap/QGIS, identify map information needs, ensure accurate linkages between spatial databases and assessment data, and produce GIS-based information products.
Support the development of communication materials, including blog posts and social media posts.
profile_positions.title: Geographic Information Systems - Disaster risk management - DataAnalysis

company.name: Risk Management Department Local Government in Cuenca - Ecuador

profile_positions.company: Risk Management Department Local Government in Cuenca - Ecuador
profile_positions.description:
Asses in natural risk management for making decisions, generating reports, warning alerts, and dashboards regularly using data from various sources and knowledge about Emergency Operation Committee Manual for taking decisions.
Implement, collect, analyze, and manage information on different subjects such as Water and Distribution, Health, Infrastructure, essentials building, humanitarian assistance (Sphere), security, education, and culture, for preparedness, response, and recovery.
Coordinate, promote and create innovative projects and strengthen capacities oriented at disaster risk reduction such as Resilient Cities – UNISDR, and Urban Planning UNPD, including others such as Sustainable Development Goals – SDG having as base Sendai Framework, allowing be included in some international programs such as Sphere.
Coordinate and create protocols, manuals, technologies, and standardization of knowledge for adequate monitoring and following of natural or anthropogenic threats, working closely with communities, and authorities.  
Use Microsoft Office package, Power BI, ArcGIS, and QGIS to generate tentative prediction models, data analysis, and maps, incorporating in manuals, presentations, and technical reports including transparency, integrity, control, veracity, and quality of the information.
Provide training and assistance to stakeholders on the technical process required, and implement quality reports, coordinating with governance and different teams.
Experience in project or organizational operations, finance, compliance, donor reporting, scheduling, or bookkeeping.
Experience running virtual meetings using Zoom or Teams and working with a geographically dispersed team, especially during, and after the pandemic COVID-19.
Knowledge and training: Sphere (Humanitarian assistance) Incident Command System USAID/OFDA,  COE Manual, Resilient Cities, Disaster Risk Reduction.
profile_positions.title: Head of Monitoring and Follow-up Coordination

company.name: Comprehensive security training and education center for people Independent professional - CECAPAUST

profile_positions.company: Comprehensive security training and education center for people Independent professional - CECAPAUST
profile_positions.description:
Train security guards in risk management.
Identify risk areas in the institutions and implement some actions to be prepared and respond to an emergency.
Help vulnerable people and define possible hazards in different sceneries.
Generate maps with the most necessary information to be helpful with the first responder's institutions.
profile_positions.title: Tutor

profile_positions.description:
One of the biggest challenges I had was to train the authorities on the importance of disaster risk management and propose a public policy on its inclusion as a transversal axis in a local government in the third largest city in Ecuador, to create a structure, define baselines and protocols, methodologies, collect, analyze and map information, allowing in the end, to define the most important areas to focus, building prevention, response,
recovery and resilience actions, obtaining the current Public Policy Administrative Resolution for the Creation of the Department of Risk Management of the Local Government of Cuenca - Ecuador, and helping with the implementation of its structure, with a team of 20 people and a budget of 500,000 dollars, being an internal part, as head of one of its departments.

Design, and help with the implementation of the Situational and Monitoring and Following- Up Room events in the Citizen Security Council Cuenca - Ecuador.  The project was approved and implemented, working until 2022 and with expansion plans until 2025.
profile_positions.title: Risk manager Consultant

company.name: National Secretary for Risk and Emergency Management

profile_positions.company: National Secretary for Risk and Emergency Management
profile_positions.description:
Learn and improve my knowledge about hazards, risks, emergencies, and new terminology of Disaster Risk Reduction. Collect, manage, analyze and implement the department that I was in charge of.
Monitoring real-time kinds of events and creating a database.
Implement an operative office with a new team in the security-integrated system 911, allowing generate early alerts in constant communications with community and primer responders.
Links and joins with first responses institutions at the local, regional and national levels.
Train and collect a database of information about communities and authorities.
Analyze and generate strong and valuable technical reports, with statistics and maps for taking decisions.
Identify the most important vulnerable people, areas, cities, etc., using a public geographic database to create a new database to have its own verified information and share it with all of the departments to analyze, create and implement prevention plans, generating protocols and contingency plans to response and recovery.
My team was in charge to keep uploading the database, creating fast and easy technical reports, and statistics, and being important to have all the information ready in case of the taking decision need or an emergency, and have to activate the COE Emergency Operational Committee, and have to present the technical report to the authorities.
profile_positions.title: Head of the situational room

profile_positions.description:
I worked on the implementation of a Spatial Data Infrastructure Platform that was Development of Research and Academia linked with Polytechnic Catalunya University, where I had to go once to train and strengthen institutional capacities in Barcelona with the team.

I had to coordinate, generate and implement the strategy for the project, meetings, training, and agreements between ten or more Universities in Ecuador, training, promoting, and developing technical reports, and manuals that include some parameters to do the platform work and the standards for the geographical information system as well.

Obtaining a successful project that allowed us as a University to be part of the projects in Red CLARA and be recognized at the international level.
profile_positions.title: Researcher at the Center for Research, Development, and Innovation of the University of Cuenca

company.name: IDE RedCLARA - Latin American Cooperation of Advanced Networks

profile_positions.company: IDE RedCLARA - Latin American Cooperation of Advanced Networks
profile_positions.description:
As technical responsible for Project LATIN IDE, I was in charge to coordinate, generate and implement the strategy for the project, meetings, training, and agreements between six countries of Latin America of different Universities, Colombia, Venezuela, Chile, Uruguay, Ecuador, and Argentina.

We analyze the database and define some standards to follow, generate manuals, create plans and projects about Spatial Data Infrastructure, and managing the geographical information system, define goals, schedules, and results, follow the activities, motiving and promote obtain the proposal results.

At the end of the project and after obtaining our goal, we present the successful project at the annual conference of Red CLARA in Uruguay, in some forums in Colombia, and implemented it in other projects.

Speaker at different international university events such as Colombia – Universidad del Quindío and Uruguay.
profile_positions.title: Latin American Coordinator for Project LATIN IDE - Spatial Data Infrastructure

company.name: National Institute of Statistics and Census - INEC - Ecuador

profile_positions.company: National Institute of Statistics and Census - INEC - Ecuador
profile_positions.description: Review, analyze, systematize and add the information to a database for the 2010 National Census - Ecuador
profile_positions.title: Data Collection, Digitization and Analysis
